page.title: 16NAIRN MUSEUM
page.content: On the 1st of June 1985 Provost Maclean re-opened Nairn Museum in Viewfield House.The collection which belongs to{Nairn Literary Institute} has just been re-housed in 4 first floor rooms with financial assistance from the Local Council and Museums and Art Galleries in Scotland.For many years prior to 1985,the collection was housed in the attic rooms of Viewfield House.The museum's first exhibit was a young rattlesnake donated in{1858.}The museum's second exhibit was a lions head.A rabbit catcher donated a badger in{1858.}A selection of keys from Nairn's old prison can be seen alongside one of the old prison doors. The main exhibit in the Nairn room is the Town scales, weights and measures which were last used in{1824.}Many of the exhibits come from abroad because many Nairnites emigrated last century.
